provisions.title: Section 6A
provisions.content:
6A. Every carrier who fails to pay travel tau at the time required
 under regulation 4 or 6. as the case may be. shall be liable to a penalty equal
 to thirty per cent of the tau which shall be chargeable from the date on which
 such tau becomes due until the date of payment thereof.

provisions.title: Section 8
provisions.content:
8.-41) A Collector may at all reasonable times require the
production of, and may inspect, copies of records and returns kept by
a carrier pursuant to these Regulations and may check the accuracy of
such records and returns by requiring the production of, and inspecting,
tickets, vouchers or other documents and books of account kept by the
carrier.
        (2) A carrier who is requested by a Collector to produce
pursuant to paragraph (1) any copy of a record, return or any ticket,
voucher or other document or any book of account shall comply with
such request.
                                  EXEMPTIONS

provisions.title: Section 9
provisions.content:
9. Travel tax shall not be payable by-
           infants, that is to say, children under the age of two years;
           members of the staff of carriers (including, where the carrier is a
           corporation, directots and managers thereof) when travelling
           from Jamaica on business of the carrier in circumstances in which
           no charge w h a t w e r is made by the carrier in respect of such
           travel;
           peace corps members, that is to say, members of the organization
           promoted by the Government of the United States of America and
           known as the Peace Corps;
           members of the Canadian University Service Organization;
           persons recruited with the approval of the Minister responsible
           for labour for work in Guantanamo Bay;
           armed forces personnel, and for this purpose armed forces
           personnel shall be--
                (i) any member of the Jamaica Defence Force (whether
                    Regular or Reserve) certified, by the commanding
                    officer of that Force or by a person authorized by him,
                    to be travelling on official duty; and
                (ii) any member of the armed forces of any country other
                     than Jamaica travelling in uniform;
           intransit passengers, and for this purpose an intransit passenger
           shall be a person arriving in Jamaica on a ship or aircraft who-
                (i)    does not land in Jamaica; or
               [The ~nclusion of this page is authorized by L.N. 28/2003]
                       W E TRAVEL TRYREGUMTIONS, 1963
               (ii) is deemed by any enactment controlling or restricting
                    the admission of persons into Jamaica, not to have
                    landed in Jamaica; or
               (iii) lands in Jamaica from such ship or aircraft which
                     is brought into a port or landed on an airfield, as
                     the case may be, involuntarily by unforeseen
                     circumstances; or
                (iv) lands in Jamaica for the purpose of being transshipped,
                     and whose stay ashore is less than a period of twenty-
                     four hours; or
                (v) subject to the above, if he lands in Jamaica, does so to
                    such an extent only as does not necessitate immigration
                    inspection;
           Voluntary Service Overseas members, that is to say, the members
           of the organization promoted by the Government of the United
           Kingdom and known as the Volunteers;
           members of a national sports team who are representing Jamaica
           abroad;
           any person recruited with the approval of the Minister responsible
           for labour to work in any place outside of Jamaica in the hotel
           industry;
           cruise passengers.
                                        OFFENCES

provisions.title: Section 10
provisions.content:
10. Any carrier who contravenes or fails to comply with any of the
provisions of regulation 3, 5, 7 or 8 shall be guilty c 'an offence and shall be
liable on summary conviction before a Resident htagistrate to a fine not
exceeding five thousand dollars or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding
six months.

provisions.content:
11.-( 1) Pursuant to subsection (1) of section 3 of the Act and subject
to regulation 9, the sum of one thousand dollars is hereby prescribed in
respect of each traveller.
